intro: Leucopogon brevistylis, commonly known as the narrow-styled leucopogon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough, hairy texture. Leucopogon brevistylis is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
